abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether the document subclass supports autosaving of drafts.
overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the receiving subclass of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument] supports autosaving of drafts; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

The system expects that an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument] subclass that returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] from this property can properly handle save operations that use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/SaveOperationType/autosaveAsOperation] save operation type.

The default implementation of this property returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. To opt out of autosaving in your [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument] subclass, override this property to return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

AppKit invokes this property at various times. For example, when calling the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/updateChangeCount(_:)] method with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/ChangeType/changeDone], but without the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/ChangeType/changeDiscardable] change type, `NSDocument` uses [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/SaveOperationType/autosaveAsOperation] on the next autosave. The operation writes the document’s contents to a new file or file package, then changes the document’s current location to point to the new file or file package.

Don’t invoke this property to find out whether autosaving of a draft might occur.
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/autosavesDrafts
crawled: 2025-12-02T18:06:52Z

# autosavesDrafts

**Type Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the document subclass supports autosaving of drafts.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class var autosavesDrafts: Bool { get }
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the receiving subclass of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument] supports autosaving of drafts; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

The system expects that an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument] subclass that returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] from this property can properly handle save operations that use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/SaveOperationType/autosaveAsOperation] save operation type.

The default implementation of this property returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. To opt out of autosaving in your [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument] subclass, override this property to return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

AppKit invokes this property at various times. For example, when calling the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/updateChangeCount(_:)] method with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/ChangeType/changeDone], but without the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/ChangeType/changeDiscardable] change type, `NSDocument` uses [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/SaveOperationType/autosaveAsOperation] on the next autosave. The operation writes the document’s contents to a new file or file package, then changes the document’s current location to point to the new file or file package.

Don’t invoke this property to find out whether autosaving of a draft might occur.

## Configuring the Autosave Behavior

- **autosavesInPlace**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the document subclass supports autosaving in place.
- **preservesVersions**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the document subclass supports version management.
- **autosavedContentsFileURL**: The location of the most recently autosaved document contents.
- **autosavingFileType**: The document type to use for an autosave operation.
- **autosavingIsImplicitlyCancellable**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can cancel an in-progress autosave operation.
